http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title.value: Nebraska K-12 Fine Arts Standards: Dance

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Fine Arts Standards, adopted on March 4, 2014.
Students will develop knowledge and skills to create, perform, respond to, and connect artistic ideas and expressions through dance and movement.
Create Concepts
Students will use dance elements and choreographic principles to explore ideas and images.
Generate spontaneous movement independently to explore ideas and images (e.g., shadowing and movement imagery).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Use similes such as "flit like a butterfly" and "slither like a snake" to prompt movement exploration.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create movements that use a variety of dance elements (e.g., verbally cue students to explore a variety of imaginary environments that promote movement exploration and qualities).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Follow the leader. Move through peanut butter, strawberry gelatin, outer space, a swamp; float like a helium balloon.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Participate in movement invention, improvise with others (e.g., demonstrate the roles of leader and follower or the activity of "give and take").
Collaborate to solve simple movement problems, explore and develop ideas and concepts (e.g., create shapes as a small group, moving as a unit).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create circles, triangles, squares, chains. Create smaller groups within the larger group

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will use dance elements and choreographic principles to develop movements that communicate ideas, images, and feelings.
Generate spontaneous movement independently to develop ideas, images, and feelings (e.g., pantomime, communicate an emotion or idea through gestural movement).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Show "excitement" using a variety of movements within special boundaries. Use movement to portray what you would like to be when you grow up.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create movement sequences that combine a variety of dance elements and images (e.g., combine multiple ideas or images to create a movement sequence).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Make a movement sequence using student examples of "excitement". Create a "when I grow up" movement sequence.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Invent a movement sequence with others, improvise to generate movement ideas (e.g., use and understand the importance of cooperation and collaboration – Always say 'yes').

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Echo, pass the movement.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Explore a variety of solutions to movement problems with others to create a movement sequence (e.g., choose and order the movements in a sequence).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Define beginning, middle, end.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will use dance elements, choreographic principles, and structures to construct dances that communicate ideas, images, feelings, and experiences.

Generate spontaneous and exaggerated movement independently to construct ideas, images, feelings, and experiences (e.g., use a memory or personal narrative (glossary) to create a short movement phrase).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Through movement, express a time you were scared.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create and compare multiple movement phrases that use a variety of dance elements and simple choreographic structures (e.g., deconstruct movement to explore choreographic structures).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Explore what happens to a phrase when you change the tempo, level, direction, sequence, repetition.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Invent movement sequences with others, improvise to generate movement ideas that develop from a variety of prompts and sources (e.g., incorporate various ideas to combine and layer movement elements).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: *Respond to musical accents, rhythms, narratives, artwork, images.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Manipulate movement ideas and choose from a variety of solutions to movement problems to establish a simple movement study with others (e.g., collaborate with peers to set formations and spatial patterns for a group work using learned movement material).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: *Give students a beginning of a movement phrase and have them finish it as a group.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will employ dance elements and choreographic principles, structures, and processes to create dances that communicate ideas, images, feelings, and experiences.

Generate movement and create dance phrases to communicate ideas, images, feelings, and experiences based on inspiration from a variety of sources (e.g., create a dance phrase based on a favorite song, poem, art piece).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: ABA form, repetition, inversion, retrograde.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create a dance sequence that uses a variety of dance elements to implement simple choreographic structures and principles to fulfill choreographic intent (e.g., select phrases for expansion into dance sequences).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Edit movement phrases by changing rhythm, tempo, dynamics, use of space.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Understand and apply the role of improvisation to create choreography with others (e.g., create cohesive transitions between the phrases).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Use improvisation to create transitions. Use communication and collaboration skills to solidify choreography.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Manipulate movement ideas, choose from a variety of solutions to movement problems, and work with others to create choreography (e.g., create a group work for peers).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Works may be based on an abstract concept such as time, or a concrete subject such as a personal experience.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Create Movement
Students will explore movement skills in dance.
Explore locomotor and non-locomotor movement to develop dance technique (e.g., gross motor movements).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Skip, hop, march, sway, swing, spin, jump.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Develop body awareness and explore how the body moves through space and time (e.g., stretch, reach, bend, fold, twist, shrink, grow).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Axial movements, balance, spatial exploration.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will develop movement skills in dance.
Demonstrate whole body movements with flexibility and endurance to develop dance technique (e.g., execute exercises and combinations that build strength, awareness, coordination, control).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Demonstrate and practice proper alignment, isolations, implement warm-up, cool-down routine.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Demonstrate ability to move rhythmically, explore levels in space, shift weight, with and without locomotion to perform dance (e.g., plié, triplet, gallop, battement, three-point turn, grapevine, lunge, balance).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Incorporate arm movements and travel across the floor. Combine in a small series. Try with a variety of music.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Demonstrate spatial qualities and pathways including curved, straight, and zig-zag pathways; move at levels from low to middle to high; leap, roll, and combine to a variety of rhythms (e.g., plié, triplet, gallop, battement, three-point turn, grapevine, lunge, balance).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Incorporate arm movements and travel across the floor. Combine in a small series. Try with a variety of rhythms.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will comprehend and demonstrate movement skills in dance.
Execute body movements with flexibility, endurance, strength, and accuracy to develop dance technique (e.g., execute movement in a variety of dance forms with accuracy).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Explore basic steps from a teacher-created list of dance forms. Teacher models and student demonstrates.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Move in varied rhythms, explore spatial orientations, and connect a series of dance moves with differing intentions as dictated by style, genre, or other influences (e.g., use rhythm, space, weight, flow to respond to various influences).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Connect step series and perform with differing intentions apropos to the style of outside influences.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Implement technical skills from a variety of dance forms (e.g., modern, ballet, tap, jazz, hip-hop) after viewing a performance.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Bring in a guest artist that specializes in a genre. View an outside performance and replicate the choreography.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will apply movement skills in dance.

Use a variety of body movements with flexibility, endurance, strength, and proper alignment to develop form and execute dance technique (e.g., execute extended sequences in a variety of dance forms with a high rate of accuracy).
Apply time, space, weight, and flow to perform dance (e.g., use expressive musical phrasing and dynamic control).

Recognize differences and execute technical skills from a variety of dance styles (e.g., study techniques such as ballet, modern, "release technique", West African, Afro-Haitian, jazz, hip-hop, rhythm tap, Broadway tap, flamenco, Broadway theater dance, latin, ballroom).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: After completion of multiple units find similarities in technique. Attend an outside workshop and discuss differing dance styles.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Perform
Students will explore etiquette to enhance dance performance.
Identify examples of audience etiquette that support and enhance the performance experience (e.g., develop guidelines with peers and teacher for expressing opinions about dance).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Raise hand to give positive feedback, polite applause.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will employ proper etiquette to enhance dance performance.
Demonstrate appropriate behaviors and etiquette to observe and perform dance (e.g., create a set of agreed-upon criteria to evaluate dance with teacher and peers).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Invite a group to perform appropriate and inappropriate responses. Discuss the differences.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will understand how to use performance values kinesthetic awareness, concentration, focus, and etiquette to enhance dance performance.
Use appropriate behaviors and etiquette to observe, create, and perform dance movements (e.g., reflect upon personal criteria to evaluate dance, and share in class discussion).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Use student self-reflection and peer assessment. Implement evaluation skills.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Identify the impact of performance values of clarity, concentration, focus, and projection on dance performance (e.g., collaborate with peers for group work using learned movement materials).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Feedback from an informed outside source on performance values. Create an action plan on given feedback. Learn how to take constructive criticism.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Recognize how self-assessment can be used to refine dance performance (e.g., maintain a dance journal, use research, resources, notation, peer assessments, and self-reflections).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Give a few minutes at the end of each class period for journaling.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will understand how to apply performance values kinesthetic awareness, concentration, focus, and etiquette to enhance dance performance.
Apply appropriate behaviors and etiquette to observe, create, and perform dance (e.g., demonstrate safe practices for each genre, apply dance experience and knowledge, exhibit dance awareness).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Be respectful of the space, student, instructor and self. Ask students to list points of etiquette regarding individual genres.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Understand the impact of performance values of clarity, concentration, focus, and projection on dance performance (e.g., understand the concepts of solo, duet, group dance, and the impact of each).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a solo, duet or group performance reflecting a distinct personal statement. Students will conduct peer assessment.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Understand how self-assessment, teacher, and peer feedback can be used to refine dance performance (e.g., maintain a dance portfolio: journal, research, ideas, drawings, print-media clippings, resources, and performance notes. Recognize dance may look different to an audience vs. the way it feels to a performer).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Interview an audience member and a dancer to get varying views. Apply constructive criticism from feedback to future rehearsals and performances.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Respond
Students will explore critical thinking skills to evaluate dance.
Explore and discuss how elements of movement are used to communicate ideas in dance (e.g., encourage students to use descriptive words to explore imagery).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: View photos or videos of dance and discuss imagery, shapes, and ideas. Discuss student-generated free movement activities.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will develop critical thinking skills to analyze and evaluate dance.
Develop and discuss how elements of movement are used to communicate ideas in dance (e.g., encourage students to use deliberate words to explore imagery).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: View photos or videos of dance and discuss imagery, emotions, and ideas. Think-pair-share student-generated free movement activities.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Students will demonstrate critical thinking skills to analyze and evaluate dance.

Explain and interpret how elements of movement and choreographic structures are used to communicate ideas in dance (e.g., encourage students to analyze movements in order to explore imagery and give perception).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Research the connections between dance styles. Discover the uses of cultural dances in order to communicate.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Recognize and discuss the use of dance elements and choreographic forms and structures in a variety of dance compositions (e.g., view live or recorded dance performance and discuss, compare, and contrast).
Students will apply critical thinking skills to analyze and evaluate dance.

Use accurate dance terminology to describe how elements of movement and choreographic structures are used to communicate ideas in dance (e.g., use written and verbal expression to analyze dance in response to dance observation, creation, and performance).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Write a review and compare it to a professional review. View an episode of "So You Think You Can Dance" or "Dancing With the Stars." Write and compare student and judge critiques.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Analyze the use of dance elements and choreographic forms and structures in a variety of significant, current dance works for the 21st century (e.g., implement analytical skills to examine current companies and/or choreographers).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Research a contemporary, emerging choreographer and write a report. Explore a current dance company and assess requirements for admission.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Connect
Students will explore cultural and interdisciplinary connections with dance.
Use dance to connect to social events, ideas, and traditions (e.g., list the reasons people dance, sharing personal dance experiences; family events, social gatherings, to express emotions).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a word/picture wall using these examples.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Use other arts disciplines to support ideation for dance creation and performance (e.g., understand how music, visual art, media and theatre can be combined with dance).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Add music to your movement. Use artwork to inspire movement. Take turns filming each other. Tell a story through movement.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Explore how health and nutrition enhance dance ability (e.g., discuss how exercise and nutrition make you feel).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Contribute to a list of favorite foods; discuss the relationship between food, energy and exercise.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Recognize that jobs in dance are possible.
Students will identify cultural and interdisciplinary connections with dance.
Use dance to discover social events, ideas, and traditions from a local context (e.g., investigate how dance reflects culture).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Learn a dance from one's heritage and teach it to the class. Explain when and by whom the dance is performed, and the cultural significance.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Identify how other academic disciplines support and enhance ideation and understanding for dance creation and performance (e.g., combine dance with other academic disciplines relating to coursework).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a dance about movement of tectonic plates, times table, orbit of the planets.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Identify how health and nutrition enhance dance ability (e.g., recognize that some foods and activities are more healthful than others).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: List, compare/contrast healthy and unhealthy choices. Understand how the body responds to small and large movements, stretching, and aerobic activity.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Identify a variety of dance-related careers.
Students will understand cultural, interdisciplinary, and historical connections with dance.
Use dance to understand concepts in U.S. history and relate them to significant events, ideas, and traditions from a national context (e.g., investigate what role dance played in U.S. history).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Choose a style of dance, and explore the origins and people who pioneered the dance form.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Analyze how other arts and academic disciplines are integrated into dance creation and performance (e.g., recognize who, what, when, where, why, and how it connects to other disciplines when creating dance pieces).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Discuss technical elements (e.g., costume, set, lighting) that convey the "givens" of a piece of literature.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Understand how dance has the ability to enhance physical and emotional health (e.g., recognize shifting moods and the ways dance can help explore and move through them).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Create a dance describing an emotion.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Investigate a variety of dance-related professions and the necessary training.
Students will apply cultural, interdisciplinary, and historical connections with dance.
Use dance to apply concepts in world history and relate them to significant events, ideas, and traditions from a global context (e.g., research the role dance played globally and throughout time).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Explore the influences of various global dances by researching historical, social, and cultural contexts.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Demonstrate how other arts disciplines are integrated into dance creation and performance (e.g., understand the principles underlying collaboration by learning or creating dances in cooperation with students working in other disciplines, or by using elements and skills from other disciplines).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Music: joint project with a student composer. Visual Arts: relationship between space, objects, viewer in art installations. Theatre: sing and act while dancing. Media Arts: create a music video.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Apply health and nutrition to enhance dance ability (e.g., set goals for healthy behaviors that may enhance dance experiences).

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Investigate bodywork practices, (e.g., yoga) that may remain lifelong pursuits.

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Identify various dance-related professions and how they impact the field of dance.

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: Brainstorm and research a dance-related profession.
